bullets: Certificate of Merit for Academic Excellence (2023)

text: Supervisor: Dr. Pritam Chakraborty (Department of Aerospace Engineering, IIT Kanpur)
Objective: Develop a phase-field damage model for low cycle fatigue of aluminium alloys, incorporating contact, friction, and plastic closure.
Approach: Utilize Abaqus with custom subroutines UMAT and UEL to simulate the behavior of aluminium alloys under LCF conditions, accounting for residual stresses and complex interactions.
bullets: Phase Field Damage Model of Al Alloy Under Low Cycle Fatigue* | ISRO Project

text: Supervisor: Dr. Sanjay Mishra (Department of Mechanical Engineering, MMMUT Gorakhpur)
Objective: Develop a finite element model in ANSYS to simulate turning operations and analyze deformation, stress, and shear stress.
Approach:Utilize finite element approximation, elemental equation assembly, and boundary condition application to simulate the turning process.
Results: The model can serve as an alternative for experimental studies. This model is capable to estimate deformation, stress and strain distributions.
bullets: Simulation and Analysis of Turning Operation Using ANSYS

Developed finite element codes for elastic bar and beam analysis using Lagrange, hierarchic, and Hermite cubic shape functions, validating solutions against analytical methods. (Introduction to Finite Element Methods) (Apr'24 )
Compared FDM, FEM, and FVM for solving a 3-element system's differential equation (Computational Methods) (Nov'23 )
Literature review focusing on Machine Learning applications for predicting mechanical properties, such as strength, toughness, hardness, brittleness, and ductility. | Self Project (Jan'24 )
Soft Skills: Latex, MS Power Point, MS Word, MS Excel
